intro: Gymnanthes rigida, commonly known as the rigid gymnanthes, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. Gymnanthes rigida typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark is thick and fibrous, and it is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
